greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Take the integer partition with Heinz number n, divide all parts by the GCD of the parts, then take the Heinz number of the resulting partition.
comment: The Heinz number of an integer partition (y_1,...,y_k) is prime(y_1)*...*prime(y_k).
This sequence is idempotent, meaning a(a(n)) = a(n) for all n.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..65537
Index entries for sequences computed from indices in prime factorization
program: (PARI) A316437(n) = if(1==n,1,my(f = factor(n), pis = apply(p -> primepi(p), f[, 1]~), es = f[, 2]~, g = gcd(pis)); factorback(vector(#f~, k, prime(pis[k]/g)^es[k]))); \\ _Antti Karttunen_, Aug 06 2018
results.author: _Gus Wiseman_, Jul 03 2018
